name: Tveirherjar
description: The Tveirherjar is a formidable undead creature with a strong physical presence, exhibiting a characteristic dark and menacing aura. It wields a longsword that absorbs light, creating an ominous atmosphere around it.
memorable: Its ability to curse creatures to become undead and its multiattack capability makes it a unique and dangerous adversary.
goals: To track and curse einherjar to expand its undead ranks.
relations: Often encountered alongside other undead or as a part of necromantic gatherings.
environment: Typically found in dark, gloomy locations, often near battlefields or sites of past conflict.
strengths: High strength and physical resilience, making it a formidable opponent in combat.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to magical attacks and counterplay from aware players can diminish its effectiveness.
attacks: Can wield its Niflheim longsword to deal slashing and necrotic damage, as well as use ranged attacks and debilitate foes with its terrifying glare.
most_powerful_ability: Curse of the Tveirherjar, capable of transforming enemies into undead if they are slain by its powerful curse.
equipment: Niflheim longsword that absorbs light and has unique magical properties, crumbling away upon the Tveirherjar's death.
senses: Possesses truesight up to 60 feet, allowing it to see through illusions and invisibility.
skills: Has a proficiency in stealth, making it capable of moving quietly and remaining undetected.
additional_information: Immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.
Resistant to slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.
Can locate einherjar within 1,000 feet, unaffected by running water.
Becomes more dangerous when its hit points drop below 30 due to Battle Frenzy.
Can paralyze foes with its terrifying glare for up to one minute.
